structure.unit: COUNTIES, CITIES, AND OTHER LOCAL UNITS

law.catch_line: Responsibility for liabilities of annexed area -- Uniform taxation.
law.text: Whenever any unincorporated territory is annexed by a city, the annexing city shall be liable for any indebtedness that is attached to or exists against the territory by reason of the same being then or previously a part of any taxing district, and the annexing city shall assume the liability, so that after annexation the burden of taxation shall be uniform throughout the city.
law.history: Amended 1984 Ky. Acts ch. 416, sec. 19, effective July 13, 1984. -- Created 1980 Ky. Acts ch. 303, sec. 6, effective July 15, 1980.
